  3. Relume Vs Figma
January 20, 2025 · COMPARISON

Relume vs Figma: Planning vs Design

Relume generates Webflow sitemaps and wireframes with AI. Figma is the industry-standard collaborative design tool. One helps plan Webflow sites, one designs everything.

The one-sentence answer:
Use Relume if you are building Webflow sites and want AI planning.
Use Figma if you need a collaborative design tool for any platform.

Relume wins for Webflow workflow. Figma wins for design collaboration.

They are not competitors

Relume and Figma serve different purposes. Relume plans Webflow sites—sitemaps, wireframes, component libraries that export to Webflow. Figma designs anything—UI, UX, prototypes, handoffs for any platform.

Use them together: Plan your Webflow site with Relume, export to Webflow, then use Figma for custom illustrations and graphics.

Relume:

Best for Webflow sitemap and wireframe generation

Figma:

Best for collaborative design and prototyping

Verdict: Relume for Webflow sites, Figma for design teams

Quick comparison

Metric Relume Figma Winner
Primary use Webflow planning General design Different
Webflow export Native, seamless Plugin required Relume
Sitemap generation AI-powered Manual Relume
Real-time collaboration Limited Excellent Figma
Cost Free tier available Free tier available Tie

Where Relume wins

Webflow export

Copy and paste into Webflow. Sitemaps, wireframes, components—all export perfectly. Figma requires a plugin to export to Webflow, and it is not as seamless.

AI sitemap generation

Describe your site, Relume generates a complete sitemap with pages and sections. Figma requires manual sitemap creation. If you want AI assistance planning your site structure, Relume wins.

Component library

Relume includes a Webflow component library. Buttons, forms, navigation—all designed to work in Webflow. Figma has components but they are not Webflow-specific.

Where Figma wins

Design freedom

Design anything for any platform. Mobile apps, websites, presentations, logos. Relume is focused on Webflow sites. If you need general-purpose design, Figma wins.

Real-time collaboration

Multiple people editing simultaneously. Comments, cursors, version history. Figma is built for teams. Relume has collaboration but it is not Figma-level.

Prototyping

Interactive prototypes with smart animate. Test user flows before building. Figma is the prototyping standard. Relume does not focus on prototyping.

The ideal workflow

Use both together: Plan your Webflow site with Relume, export to Webflow for development, then use Figma for custom graphics, illustrations, and non-Webflow designs.

Relume handles the Webflow-specific planning. Figma handles the broader design work. They are complementary tools, not competitors.

Bottom line

Relume is the Webflow planning tool—AI sitemaps, wireframes, seamless export. Figma is the design standard—collaboration, prototyping, platform-agnostic.

If you are building a Webflow site, start with Relume. If you need a general design tool for any platform, use Figma. They work best together.
